posts.id: 🚨 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗢𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗧𝗼𝗽 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗻𝗶𝗲𝘀 🚨 📌 Full S_151
posts.text: 🚨 𝗛𝗶𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗢𝗽𝗽𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗲𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗧𝗼𝗽 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗻𝗶𝗲𝘀 🚨 📌 Full Stack Software Engineer – NatWest Group 📍 Location: Bangalore (In-office) 💼 Skills: Full Stack Development 💰 Salary: 8 – 14 LPA 🗓 Experience: 0 – 2 Years 👉 Apply here: https://lnkd.in/gZqUkVh7 📌 Software Development Engineer I – Amazon 📍 Location: Hyderabad, Bangalore, Chennai, Delhi (In-office) 💼 Skills: C++ / Java / Python 💰 Salary: 25 – 30 LPA 🗓 Experience: Freshers 👉 Apply here: https://lnkd.in/gwTY65ar 💡 While applying, remember: cracking these roles isn’t just about solving problems—it’s about explaining why your solution is the most optimal one under interview pressure. I personally found a big difference when I started practicing with this FREE AI coding mentor tool 👉 https://lnkd.in/gAmKRSaA It doesn’t spoon-feed answers, but instead: ✔️ Pushes you to justify your Big O while coding ✔️ Challenges you to optimize suboptimal solutions ✔️ Throws curveballs like “What if input size doubles?” ✔️ Times your explanations so you get interview-ready If you’re aiming for companies like these, this might be the practice boost you need 🚀 hashtag #Hiring hashtag #JobAlert hashtag #SoftwareEngineering hashtag #DSA hashtag #CodingInterviews hashtag #CareerGrowth

posts.id: 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗼𝗻𝗰𝗲, 𝗶𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿… …𝗳𝗿𝗼𝘇𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗮𝗻 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗲_288
posts.text: 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗼𝗻𝗰𝗲, 𝗶𝗳 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿… …𝗳𝗿𝗼𝘇𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝗮𝗻 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘆 𝗮𝘀𝗸𝗲𝗱: “𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁’𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲𝘅𝗶𝘁𝘆?” 🥲 👩‍💻 You solved the problem. 🎉 Output was correct. 😌 Confidence was high. But then, one simple question shook everything. 𝗕𝗲𝗰𝗮𝘂𝘀𝗲 𝘀𝗼𝗹𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗯𝗹𝗲𝗺 ≠ 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗵𝘆 𝗶𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗼𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗮𝗹 𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗮𝗰𝗵. Most of us practice for test cases, not for thought process. But interviews are about how you think, explain, and optimize. What helped me: ✅ Always start with brute force, then optimize. ✅ Before coding, list at least 5 edge cases. ✅ After solving, write time & space complexity. ✅ Dry-run on the worst-case input, not just samples. And here's a hack that helped me improve 10x, practicing under actual interview pressure with a timer using this FREE AI coding mentor tool https://lnkd.in/gAmKRSaA It doesn’t spoon-feed answers. Instead, it, → Forces you to justify your Big O while coding, not after → Asks "Can you do better?" when you submit suboptimal solutions → Throws complexity follow-ups: "What if input size doubles?" → Times your explanations so you get comfortable analyzing under pressure If you’ve ever felt that same fumble on “time complexity”, this might save you in your next interview. 💯 hashtag #DSA hashtag #CodingInterviews hashtag #DataStructuresAndAlgorithms hashtag #LeetCode hashtag #InterviewPreparation hashtag #ProblemSolving hashtag #DSA hashtag #CodingInterviews hashtag #AIForDevelopers hashtag #InterviewPreparation hashtag #CareerGrowth

posts.id: 𝗕𝗲 𝗵𝗼𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘁: 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝘀𝗸𝗶𝗽𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘄𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮 𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗺𝗲𝘁 _434
posts.text: 𝗕𝗲 𝗵𝗼𝗻𝗲𝘀𝘁: 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝘀𝗸𝗶𝗽𝗽𝗲𝗱 𝘄𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮 𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗺𝗲𝘁 𝗯𝗲𝗰𝗮𝘂𝘀𝗲 𝗶𝘁 𝘄𝗮𝘀 𝗻𝗼𝘁 𝗹𝗼𝗼𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗴𝗼𝗼𝗱? ✨ “𝘗𝘳𝘢𝘯 𝘫𝘢𝘺𝘦 𝘱𝘢𝘳 𝘢𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘵𝘪𝘤𝘴 𝘯𝘢 𝘫𝘢𝘺𝘦” Honestly, I feel you And, all this time while riding my scooty, the most discomforting part was the helmet: 👉 Earrings getting stuck 👉 Bulky, oversized fit 👉 Zero match with my vibe & aesthetics ✨ It always felt like helmets were never really made for us. That’s when I came across TVARRA. A helmet brand started by a woman, for women. 🌸 Pastel colours 🌸 Floral prints 🌸 Lightweight fit and above all, 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗳𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘀𝗮𝗳𝗲𝘁𝘆. And in that moment I realised, It wasn’t just a product. It was a statement. 💜 You matter. Your safety matters. Because for women who ride their own roads, safety shouldn’t come at the cost of self-expression. When you wear a TVARRA, you’re not just stepping outside. You’re stepping into your own story. 𝗕𝗼𝗹𝗱. 𝗙𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀. 𝗙𝗿𝗲𝗲. Thank you TVARRA for changing the game 🚀 hashtag #WomenWhoRide hashtag #SafetyWithStyle hashtag #Tvarra hashtag #RideWithConfidence hashtag #WomenOnWheels hashtag #StyleMeetsSafety hashtag #SafetyFirstAlways hashtag #FearlessRiders hashtag #WomenWhoLead hashtag #RideSafeRideFree hashtag #NotJustAGear hashtag #SafetyWithStyle hashtag #HerRideHerRules hashtag #WomenWhoInspire hashtag #BoldOnTheRoad

posts.id: “𝗗𝗦𝗔 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗵𝗮𝗶, 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘂𝗺𝗲 𝗯𝗵𝗶 𝗽𝗼𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗵𝗲𝗱 𝗵𝗮𝗶… 𝗳𝗶𝗿 𝗯𝗵𝗶 _248
posts.text: “𝗗𝗦𝗔 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗵𝗮𝗶, 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘂𝗺𝗲 𝗯𝗵𝗶 𝗽𝗼𝗹𝗶𝘀𝗵𝗲𝗱 𝗵𝗮𝗶… 𝗳𝗶𝗿 𝗯𝗵𝗶 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄𝘀 𝗰𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗻𝗮𝗵𝗶 𝗵𝗼 𝗿𝗮𝗵𝗲.” I got this message the other day. I’ve spoken to so many freshers who are in similar situations. But here’s the thing nobody admits openly → getting a job isn’t just about solving questions. Yes, DSA matters. But it’s only one piece of the puzzle. To get noticed: → Work on at least 𝟮 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁𝘀 you can explain (not just tutorial clones) → Strengthen your 𝗖𝗦 𝗳𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗮𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹𝘀 (OOPs, DBMS, OS, Networking — they always come up) → Practice thinking out loud in interviews (𝗺𝗼𝗰𝗸 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗶𝗲𝘄𝘀 help the most) If even one pillar is missing, shortlisting becomes 10x harder. And I get it… it feels like too much to handle alone. Because it is. But now you can easily prepare 1:1 with senior engineers who’ve sat on the other side of the interview table. 💯 The best part? You can connect with them for FREE here: https://lnkd.in/gsS_jzjR They bring decades of experience — guiding you with mock interviews, resumes, custom prep roadmaps, and insider tips. In fact, these senior SDEs have already helped 3000+ students crack offers at Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Adobe, IBM and more. 💪 So if you’re feeling stuck, don’t blame yourself. Get the right direction. At the end of the day, preparation is your responsibility. But the right guidance? That’s the game-changer ✨ hashtag #interviewpreparation hashtag #techjobs hashtag #careerprep hashtag #jobsearch hashtag #firstjob hashtag #engineeringstudents hashtag #placementseason hashtag #fresherjobs hashtag #codinginterviews hashtag #DSA hashtag #mockinterviews hashtag #careerroadmap hashtag #paidpartnership hashtag #careerguidance hashtag #jobseekers hashtag #mentorship
